title: Does the HDD include interconnection data?

title: Is the terminology used in the conceptual design fully defined?

title: Does the Conceptual Design data in the HDD include a high-level description, such as a block diagram or HDL definition, which outlines the major functions and shows the flow of information between these functions?
description: Does the Conceptual Design data in the HDD include a high-level description, such as a block diagram or HDL definition, which outlines the major functions and shows the flow of information between these functions?

title: Does the Conceptual Design data in the HDD include the mechanical structure, which describes the arrangement of the hardware item, such as drawings or sketches showing exterior package, printed circuit board arrangement, connector selection and location, and major interconnect wiring?
description: Does the Conceptual Design data in the HDD include the mechanical structure, which describes the arrangement of the hardware item, such as drawings or sketches showing exterior package, printed circuit board arrangement, connector selection and location, and major interconnect wiring?

title: Does the Conceptual Design data in the HDD include architectural features and partitioning that are important from an airworthiness point of view (such as EMI, lightning, shock or vibration protection, unused functions in major components as well as man-machine interfaces, ergonomic factors, lighting characteristics and display resolution)?
description: Does the Conceptual Design data in the HDD include architectural features and partitioning that are important from an airworthiness point of view (such as EMI, lightning, shock or vibration protection, unused functions in major components as well as man-machine interfaces, ergonomic factors, lighting characteristics and display resolution)?

title: Does the high level design description include architectural constraints related to safety, including those necessary to address design errors and functional, component over-stress, reliability and robustness defects?
description: Does the high level design description include architectural constraints related to safety, including those necessary to address design errors and functional, component over-stress, reliability and robustness defects?

title: Does the high level design description include implementation constraints on software or other system components?

title: Does the high level design description identify major components and describe the way they contribute to the hardware safety requirements and the impact of unused functions?
description: Does the high level design description identify major components and describe the way they contribute to the hardware safety requirements and the impact of unused functions?

title: Have derived requirements, including the interface definition, been fed back to the requirements capture process ?

title: Have requirement omissions and errors been fed back to the appropriate process for resolution?

title: Does the HDD include a Top-Level Drawing that uniquely identifies the hardware item and all assemblies, subassemblies, components and relevant documentation that define the hardware item?
